Extract data from a codebook object

Source: R/cb_create.r
cb_get_data.Rd

Codebook objects created by cb_create() and friends contain several transformed versions of the originally passed dataset. These can be extracted using cb_get_data().

Usage

cb_get_data(cb, format = c("factors", "haven", "values"))

Arguments

cb

An object of class "li_codebook" as produced by cb_create() or a variant.

format

Format of the returned data; see below for details.

Value

A tibble with variables formatted based on the format argument.

  • For format = "values", all variables retain the same values as the original dataset, including values for user missings. The data may reflect transformations made by variants of cb_create() – e.g., for cb_create_redcap(), integer coercion and propagation of user missings across checkbox variables.

  • For "haven", value labels and user missings are encoded using class "haven_labelled"`

  • For "factors", all variables with value labels are converted to factors, and all user missings are converted to NA.
